meanings.definition: To remove a screw by turning it counterclockwise.
meanings.sent1: She was unscrewing the lightbulb from the lamp.
meanings.sent2: He always unscrews the lid of the jar carefully.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried unscrewing the wrong part and got its wires tangled.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, it felt like nature was unscrewing the light from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of unscrewing echoed through the empty room.

meanings.definition: The act of loosening or removing a screw by turning it counterclockwise.
meanings.sent1: I heard the unscrewing of the hinges as the door swung open.
meanings.sent2: The unscrewing of the bolts took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The unscrewing of the cap revealed a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: The unscrewing of the faucet handle signaled the start of the repair.
meanings.sent5: The unscrewing of the lid released a burst of fresh air.
